base

Class ImageGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • base.ImageGraph

  • public class ImageGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for representing a graph on an image. A vertex is a Point in the image.
    Author:
    ALechovsky

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.List<Pair<org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.Point,org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.Point>> edges
      A list of edges in the image
      java.util.List<org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.Point> vertices
      A list of vertices - Points in the image.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      A constructor which takes a list of horizontal lines and a list of vertical lines, calculates intersections of all vertical lines with all horizontal lines, and fills the vertices property accordingly.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageGraph

        public ImageGraph(java.util.List<Pair<org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.Point,org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.Point>> horizontal,
                  java.util.List<Pair<org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.Point,org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.Point>> vertical,
                  org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.Mat image,
                  int groupPointsThreshold)
        A constructor which takes a list of horizontal lines and a list of vertical lines, calculates intersections of all vertical lines with all horizontal lines, and fills the vertices property accordingly.
        Parameters:
        horizontal - Horizontal lines in the graph
        vertical - Vertical lines in the graph
        image - The image over which the graph is created
        groupPointsThreshold - The distance two points need to be apart in order to be grouped into one point

    • Method Detail

      • getRobotPositionInGraph

                                                                                              double vertexDist)
        A function to determine where is the closest in the graph to a selected Point
        Parameters:
        p - A Point to be used in the calculation
        Returns:
        The Point which lies on the graph the closest to the given Point
